name: Preethi Reddy
title: Senior Frontend Developer - Web Components & AI Integration Specialist
professional_summary: Architected Web Components migration strategy using Stencil.js for healthcare applications, establishing Custom Elements API standards and Shadow DOM encapsulation patterns that enabled framework-agnostic component reusability across ReactJS and Vue.js implementations

Built Model Context Protocol servers using TypeScript and Node.js to connect AI agents with frontend applications, creating standardized communication interfaces that allowed LLM-powered tools to interact directly with Web Components through defined API contracts

Delivered responsive component libraries using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with ES Modules packaging, implementing browser compatibility strategies and polyfills that ensured consistent rendering across legacy and modern browsers while maintaining WCAG accessibility standards

Configured build tooling pipelines with Vite and Webpack to bundle Stencil.js components, establishing versioning strategies and backward compatibility protocols that prevented breaking changes during incremental migration from monolithic frontend architectures to modular Web Components

Developed MCP client integrations within healthcare UI using TypeScript, connecting frontend Web Components to AI agent services through standardized protocol implementations that enabled real-time patient data analysis while maintaining HIPAA compliance requirements

Transformed legacy ReactJS applications into Web Components using Custom Elements API and Shadow DOM, documenting migration risks, effort estimations, and technical dependencies in comprehensive guides that accelerated team adoption and reduced implementation errors

Implemented design system foundations using Stencil.js component library architecture, creating reusable UI patterns with documented API contracts, Storybook integration, and MDX-based technical documentation that standardized frontend development across government portal applications

Collaborated with AI platform teams to expand Web Components functionality for agent interoperability, designing component interfaces that exposed healthcare data through Model Context Protocol servers, enabling AI-powered clinical decision support tools integration

Optimized frontend performance in banking applications using JavaScript and TypeScript refactoring, applying code-splitting techniques with Rollup bundler and lazy-loading strategies that reduced initial page load times and improved user experience metrics

Integrated Web Test Runner and Jest testing frameworks for component library validation, establishing automated quality assurance workflows that verified Custom Elements behavior, Shadow DOM isolation, and cross-framework compatibility before production deployments
